snippet: An appellate court ruled correctly that the state cannot deny driver’s licenses to young unauthorized immigrants who have permission to work.
abstract: Editorial praises appeals court for ruling that Arizona cannot deny driver's licenses to young unauthorized immigrants whom the federal government has given protection from deportation and permission to work; contends Gov Jan Brewer's executive order was motivated by spiteful politics.
lead_paragraph: An appellate court ruled correctly that the state cannot deny driver’s licenses to young unauthorized immigrants who have permission to work.

keywords.value: Dream Act (Development, Relief and Education for Minors Act)
keywords.name: subject
